history.content:
There are many great free group tutoring resources for students taking EE, CS, and EECS courses. However, some students prefer one-on-one interactions. For this reason, the department maintains a roster of folks available for private tutoring. 
 
If you're interested in adding your name to our tutor list, please fill out this form. You must have received a grade of B or better at UC Berkeley to list a class. By completing the form, you agree to abide by the campus code of conduct and allow us to share listed information. The roster will be available on the EECS Dept website and anyone with a CalNet log in will be able to view it.
 
The department's role is simply to facilitate an introduction between tutors/tutees. Should someone contact you, you should work to arrange time, location, pay, etc. For reference, the campus's rate for individual tutoring is $15.11/hour. 
 
We have a new roster each academic year. If you were listed last year,  you will need to resubmit. As always, we are especially in need of tutors for upper division courses. 

As a reminder, opportunities, resources, and announcement are still being posted to this page until our weekly announcement emails resume. Recent posts include a scholarship, a NASA prorgram, and an Engineering/Tech Career Conference
history.subject: Private Tutor List + Other Opportunities
